column4: hi room, can someone help me with connecting pidgin from behind squid proxy??
hi room, can someone help me with connecting pidgin from behind squid proxy??
have you entered the proxy settings in Pidgin?
he's just kidding haha
yup.
what IM protocl are you using?
neither of them work?
can you open 'gnome-network-properties'?
is the proxy info entered in there/
System>Preferences>Network Proxy
is all the traffic on the computer going through the proxy?
can you connect to the internet through your web browser?
go accounts>yahoo>Edit account
what does the 'proxy' tab say?
can you choose 'gnome settings'?
under 'proxy type' choose 'use GNOME proxy settings'
oh... -Do  you own the proxy?
I imagine you'd have to enable port 5050 tunneling through SQUID. I don't know how, though
is the proxy server inside your LAN?
try changing the 'pager' port to 80 or something in Yahoo account settings?
it still fails?
when it fails with port 80, what is the error?
try this for Google Talk - http://ubuntuforums.org/showpost.php?p=5846942&postcount=3
those are the settings you need to configure Gtalk with
